title: Building Resilience, One Good Idea at a Time
summary: A foundational manifesto for Resilient Tomorrow, sharing Mike's systems analysis background and personal journey from corporate extraction to community creation. Introduces the 'solarpunk' vision of technology serving communities rather than extracting from them.

Narrative.summary: Shift from extraction-based systems to creation-based communities that serve human well-being.

level0: Recognize 'maximum consumption' point—where maintaining possessions outweighs utility
Question the difference between money and true wealth
level1: Understand wealth as access through community, not just individual accumulation
See abundance vs. scarcity as choices we make, not fixed realities
level2: Embrace 'solarpunk' vision—technology serving communities rather than extracting from them
Practice creation over extraction in personal and professional choices
level3: Develop systems thinking to identify failure points and build resilient alternatives
Lead community transitions from dependency to co-sufficiency

Community.summary: Build supportive local networks through shared projects that create abundance rather than scarcity.

level0: Start conversations with neighbors about shared needs and resources
level1: Organize simple sharing projects—tool libraries, skill exchanges
level2: Establish ongoing community systems that reduce individual consumption
level3: Create demonstration models that inspire broader community adoption
Share blueprints and lessons learned with other communities

Knowledge.summary: Apply systems analysis thinking to identify vulnerabilities and build more resilient alternatives.

level0: Learn to see systemic problems rather than individual failures
Understand how small inefficiencies accumulate into system breakdowns
level1: Practice identifying where systems extract value vs. create value
Study examples of successful community-based alternatives
level2: Develop skills in process analysis and continuous improvement
Learn to design systems that grow stronger with use rather than weaker
level3: Master systems design principles for community resilience
Teach others to identify and improve broken systems

Power.summary: Generate own power systems and reduce dependency on centralized energy infrastructure.

level0: Audit current energy usage and identify reduction opportunities
level1: Install basic renewable energy systems—solar chargers, small wind
Learn energy storage basics and backup power systems
level2: Design home energy systems that reduce grid dependency
Connect with neighbors for shared energy projects
level3: Build neighborhood microgrids and energy sharing networks
Develop expertise to help others achieve energy independence
